1.text: Pour ⅔ cup (158 mL) of school glue into a bowl.

2.text: Stir ½ tsp (5 g) of baking soda and ¼ cup (60 mL) of water with the glue.

3.text: Mix 2 to 3 cups (470 to 710 mL) of shaving cream into the bowl.

4.text: Squeeze in a few drops of food coloring until you achieve your desired color.

5.text: Start by gradually adding 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of contact solution into the mixture.

6.text: Mix 1 tsp (9 g) of Borax powder into 1 cup (240 mL) of hot water.

7.text: Pour ½ cup (120 mL) of school glue into a separate bowl.

8.text: Add ½ cup (120 mL) of shaving cream into the same bowl as the glue.

9.text: Mix the slime until all of the lumps are gone.

10.text: Mix in slightly more than 1 tablespoon (7.5 g) of cornstarch.

12.text: Add 3 teaspoons (15 mL) of the liquid Borax mixture to your slime.

14.text: Stir 1⁄2 cup (120 mL) of shampoo and ¼ cup (30 g) cornstarch together in a large bowl.

15.text: Squirt 3 drops of food coloring into the mixture.

16.text: Pour and stir 6 US tbsp (89 mL) of water into the mixture.

17.text: Fold and squish the slime for at least 5 minutes.
